headline: Chicken Tetrazzini IV
description: Chicken, mushrooms and spaghetti baked in a rich, creamy white sauce flavored with Parmesan cheese and sherry.
name: Chicken Tetrazzini IV
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package spaghetti, broken into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti, and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until smooth. Remove from heat, and gradually stir in chicken broth and cream.

Return to heat, and bring to a low boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add sherry, then stir in cooked spaghetti, mushrooms, and chicken. Pour mixture into the prepared baking dish, and top with Parmesan cheese.
Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly and lightly browned.

review.reviewBody: Took the advice of others and added some garlic, onion and nutmeg, Husband loved it but myself I added hot sauce on mine to give it a little zip, I would make it again.
I used a lot of the suggestions from Crystal S. The nutmeg was a very interesting addition. Served with steamed broccoli. New family favorite!
I made this tonight. Heaven is close by. Oh this is so good! I will admit that my contribution to tweaking the recipe is that I am sure I used more than 1/2 cup of Parmesan. I'm sure I did!
Great basic recipe; add Old El Paso Chopped Green Chiles (mild) and har of Diced Pimientos
Everyone loved!

We loved this. Very easy and fast to make. Followed the recipe pretty much except I used half& half instead of heavy cream and added a small sliced onion to the fresh mushrooms. Great flavor. Definitely will be making this again.
Good recipe. Consider adding more vegetables, like celery, carrots, zucchini. I would double the chicken
This was a delicious meal! The only 2 changes were substituting my favorite sweet Reisling for the sherry and substituting Asiago cheese for the Parmigiano-Reggiano. Can't wait to make it again!
Delicious! Went by the recipe. Just seasoned the chicken when I cooked it. Will make again!!!
I like it a lot. I only used half the pasta; and I used fresh mushrooms. I thought it needed something else, so I threw in garlic powder and dried thyme. I will make it again!
I have made this so many times. I'm lactose intolerant so it's nice to make this creamy sauce with lactose-free cream.

I made this to the directions and it was delicious. I added some pasta water to the final dish to increase the moisture content. It was sooo good. I can't wait to make it again and try the fresh mushrooms, and add some additional cheese, and maybe use a lower fast milk.
This was very easy. Are use leftover rotisserie chicken and didn’t change the recipe at all. It was very very good
I thought it was very good. I added peas and used milk and not cream but still a great dish.
This was just OK, lacked a l lot of flavor. Next time I will add nutmeg, onion & use less butter for a healthier version.
I followed the directions mostly. Had to add flavor, but this was a great guide.
Excellent recipe, nice and easy. I did add 2 pieces of bacon to the recipe, fabulous!
Doubled it. Cooked fresh mushrooms & garlic in butter. Also, I baked my chicken with lots of seasonings on 350 for 20 minutes then diced it. It was delicious.
Really good. I used sautéed fresh mushrooms instead of canned, and I added some blanched broccoli. Delicious and complete meal
I added 1/2 cup yellow chopped onion, and 3 cloves minced garlic and sautéed them in the butter, prior to mixing in the flour. Really added a lot of flavor to the dish and everyone LOVED it!
My daughter and I love this! I didn't change a thing. Tastes just like my Mom's recipe. This will be a regular entree in our home. Thank you for sharing!

Made as original recipe was written and found it to be tolerable but quite bland- like nursing home or big buffet food. Will try again with some of the adjusted recommendations because the foundation is there- just needs something more.
Easy to make and tastes amazing!
I left out the mushrooms because of a picky family member, but otherwise used the recipe as written. Delicious! Will definitely fix again.

Found this recipe in an old Betty Crocker cookbook. Was in a pinch to make dinner and realized I had all the ingredients on hand. I did sauté onion in the butter before adding the flour, and I sprinkled some breadcrumbs on top before baking. Turned out very well, albeit a little starchy. Tasted like the 1970s!
Added onion sautéed with fresh mushrooms

My husband and I liked this fine, but honestly we made it the one time and never made it again. It comes off just a little sweet as the cream is a little overpowering in the end result for us I think. But if you that's your thing, this is a good dish.
Used sour cream instead of heavy cream.
By far the best chicken tetrazzini ever! My family loves it!
Loved it. Especially my 92 year old Mom.
Without more seasoning, this recipe would have lacked on serious flavor.
This is seriously so good. A little time consuming but a family favorite. I omit the sherry and mushrooms. I always top with shredded Parmesan cheese/mozzarella cheese and bake.
This recipe calls for too much flour. 1/4 cup to 4 Tbs of butter needs more then 1 and 1/2 cups of milk. Other then that it was good.
Loved it!!!! The only thing I changed is I used half & half instead of heavy cream. and fresh mushroom, and added onion and garlic to the mix. WOW!!!
This was not one of my favorites. Not as flavorful as I would like.
I added snap peas and fresh mushrooms. I think next time I will add baby shrimp. This was delicious!! Definitely a keeper

This was really good. The only changes I made was first, I boiled the chicken with three chicken bouillon cubes, once the chicken was cooked, I removed the chicken, but DID NOT throw away the water/broth. I then boiled the spaghetti in the same water I cooked the chicken in. This gives the spaghetti some added flavor.

Also, i added crushed potato chips on one half of it, because my husband and kids like the crunch chips on top. 

Really good recipe!
I sautéed fresh mushrooms, added frozen peas, and panko at the end to brown. Hubby
Delicious blend of flavors !! Brings back good memories when Mom used to make it.

I need to make this again! I grilled the chicken, added chopped onions and garlic to the butter and sautéed before I added the flour. I used 1/3 heavy cream 1/3 almond milk 1/3 evaporated milk. I will probably eliminate the heavy cream next time. Before I put it in the pan, I added 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper for flavor. When I put everything in the pan, I sprinkled paprika over the top. Sooooo good!!! Served with peas and garlic bread
This is a requested favourite

Creamy comfort food with a nice ratio of pasta to chicken. I lightened it up by using half the butter called for and 2% milk instead of cream. I used cornstarch instead of flour to thicken. No salt needed. I topped it with a little extra parm and bread crumbs before baking.
No flavor, way too much butter/heavy cream. Could only taste the mushrooms

It turned out great.
I used Tyson chicken strips and cut into pieces and placed peas in dish vs on the side. 
turned out well. 
will make again.

As the recipe is, it would be really bland. I added minced roasted garlic, oregano, basil, some Parmesan cheese, and used fresh mushrooms. Next time I want to increase the amount of sauce so I will be increasing the broth and cream mixture, otherwise it dries out during baking.

I used chicken tenders cooked with garlic and onion first. Then used chicken stock and lactose free 1% milk, probably about half a cup adding as needed. Also added broccoli and quite a bit of Dijon mustard. Was a big hit with everyone. Will definitely make again. Did not add sherry.

To all the so-called cooks that reviewed this dish. It is called Tetrazzini for a reason. Do a little research into the dish. Once you've made all your "improvements" it is no longer the original but is now a knock-off. Something you can find on any street corner --not worth the money.

Amazing flavour ! Delicate hints os sherry. Great way to use up leftover pasta. Added crushed garlic to butter before flour and used evaporated milk instead of cream. Also added green peas as suggested previously. Hubby loved it too.

Love this recipe. Made it 4 or 5 times with the following changes: Break the spaghetti in thirds. Use rotisserie chicken. Saute 1 cup chopped onion, 1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms, and 2 cloves minced garlic in 1-2 T olive oil first, then added all that to the already thickened sauce. For the sauce, I used 1 1/2 cups chicken broth + 1 cup 2% milk + 1/2 cup half-and-half. Also used more sherry - maybe 5 Tablespoons. BE VERY CAREFUL TO USE ONLY 1/2 OF A 16 OUNCE PACKAGE OF SPAGHETTI.
It looked kind of weird but it was OUTSTANDING!!
I had fresh mushrooms that I sautéed before adding. I only had 1/2 cup of whipping cream, so I added 1/2 cup of milk. Turned out great.

This is a good "comfort food" recipe. I followed the directions with one exception - which was to use a container of fresh baby bella mushrooms instead of canned. Once the ingredients were combined it felt dry - a criticism some other reviewers had also. I made up an additional half batch of the broth/cream/flour/wine/butter mixture and then added it to the already combined ingredients. That gave the dish a much more pleasing consistency and is something I would continue to do. I divided this into 2 smaller pans and froze one for use at a later date. The finished produce is a little rich so serving it with a healthy green salad on the side cuts some of that. While that doesn't make it a 'healthy' meal, the large salad on the side allows you to have a smaller portion of the main dish to help you keep the fat and calorie count in control.
Critique- More cheese, more sauce, and add black olives!!!

Used leftover turkey and gravy from Thanksgiving.
Sautéed 8 0z. Baby Bella mushrooms and half an onion in butter then made the roux by adding the flour, extra butter and salt. Added the extra gravy to this, along with the sherry.
Added 1 cup chicken broth and 1 cup half an half, the cooked spaghetti broken into smaller pieces, and the leftover turkey. Sprinkled with parmesan cheese.
Cooked in a 9x13 casserole dish for a little less than half an hour. Wonderful dinner!

I generally follow the recipe to the letter the first time around. Doing so I feel I'm able determine,what if any substitutions I might try. A family member has used Nutmeg rather than Sherry. I'll be considering what type of mushroom to pair with a light use of Nutmeg..
Tastes great, not hard to make, my whole family loved it. It is definitely worth a try.
This was a huge hit in my house!! I was told once it was finished to make it again. I followed the recipe exactly the only thing I changed was a bit more cheese. Wonderful highly recommend this!!!

I've been looking for a tetrazzini recipe that is similar to one that a friend made for me years and years ago. Finally, I hit upon this one, and it's the keeper. It, in its written form, is definitely not health food, but is comfort food at its best. The only changes that I made were to add a small jar of diced pimientos and about 1/4 tsp. nutmeg. If I decide to put this on regular rotation, I will try to lighten it up. But making it as written (and I with my 2 small additions) results in a tasty, easy casserole that warms up a cool evening. My family and teenage daughter's friend all loved it.
Family loved it (& they DONT like anything remotely similar)!?? Will definitely make again
Even with modifications suggested by others (sauteed onions, garlic, and fresh mushrooms), my family thought this was bland. For us, really needs some herbs. Next time I'm adding bacon!

Delicious recipe. I made this for a party of 25 using the measurement adjustment feature on this website. It made way more than needed. I followed the recipe but added fresh mushrooms, bell pepper and onion. I marinated my chicken with some lemon juice before cooking. I used both breast and thigh meat. I also used Italian herbed breadcrumbs (as suggested by another reviewer) mixed with Parmesan cheese as a top layer. I got lots of compliments and will make this for my family in the future.

I liked it because it has such a nice flavor but will add celery and onion the next time I make it as I have done in the past.
I like a little more texture but this is much easier and faster to make.
Cook34
Per other cooks comments, I used 1/2 & 1/2. I also used garlic and fresh mushrooms. And changed to a smaller portion size (serves 6). Great base recipe !
Delicious.

I made it gluten free by omitting the butter and substituting cornstarch for flour, using half as much of the flour indicated. I heated up the cream with water, reserving 1/2 cup water to mix with the cornstarch. When the cream/water was bubbly, I added the cornstarch and stirred until thickened. And of course, used gluten free spaghetti. The only other change I made was adding 1/4 cup of parmesan to the sauce. Turned out great!
Turned out great! I added broccoli. I didn't have chicken stock and used beef broth with full fat milk. Also carmalized the onions mushrooms and broccoli before I added to roux! Delish!
With some adjustments for more flavor this was delicious.

There were some glaring pros and cons to this recipe, the first of which being that its a strong base recipe but also incredibly bland as is. Another pro is the flexibility of this recipe. Too rich and creamy for your tastebuds? Decrease the heavy cream and increase the chicken broth by the same amount. Tasted like flour? Cook that flour in the butter for several minutes longer, turning it over and over until it almost smells kinda nutty and keep whisking quick when you add first the broth and then the cream. Another con? Back to that flavor thing again, this really needs it so try generous dashes of basil, fresh or dry, along with smaller dashes of nutmeg, summer savory, parsley and tarragon. Additions of fresh sautéed garlic, onion and mushrooms are fabulous to make this recipe shine. Out of fresh? Don't be worried about using garlic or onion powder if that's all ya have. My guy dislikes the texture of onion but is fine with the taste. Sometimes we take the time to puree and sauté an onion, other times we shortcut with powdered spice. Sometimes I leave it in big chunks and tell him too bad, it's onion night! Add peas, asparagus or broccoli. After minding our family's tastebuds for over 30 years, I knew when reading the recipe that I'd never make it as is but would want to add lots of flavorful additions and took liberties to do so. We've really liked the different variations that have come about by using this recipe as the bones for a really great one!

There were some glaring pros and cons to this recipe, the first of which being that its a strong base recipe but also incredibly bland as is. Another pro is the flexibility of this recipe. Too rich and creamy for your tastebuds? Decrease the heavy cream and increase the chicken broth by the same amount. Tasted like flour? Cook that flour in the butter for several minutes longer, turning it over and over until it almost smells kinda nutty and keep whisking quick when you add first the broth and then the cream. Another con? Back to that flavor thing again, this really needs it so try generous dashes of basil, fresh or dry, along with smaller dashes of nutmeg, summer savory, parsley and tarragon. Additions of fresh sautéed garlic, onion and mushrooms are fabulous to make this recipe shine. Out of fresh? Don't be worried about using garlic or onion powder if that's all ya have. My guy dislikes the texture of onion but is fine with the taste. Sometimes we take the time to puree and sauté an onion, other times we shortcut with powdered spice. Sometimes I leave it in big chunks and tell him too bad, it's onion night! Add peas, asparagus or broccoli. After minding our family's tastebuds for over 30 years, I knew when reading the recipe that I'd never make it as is but would want to add lots of flavorful additions and took liberties to do so. We've really liked the different variations that have come about by using this recipe as the bones for a really great one!
This recipe is awesome! Creamy, rich, easy!! It's worth a try to anybody who's family is a fan of total delicious-ness!! Great item to impress your family and friends

Great recipe. Made 3 changes, used fresh mushrooms instead of canned, just sauted them in the same pan I cooked the chicken in. Also, used 1/4 cup heavy cream and 3/4 cup milk to lighten it up a bit. Added 1/4 cup parmesan to the sauce and sprinkled the rest on top.

It turned out well. The only reason I give it 3 stars is because it was to rich and I had to make changes. In the future I will find a way to use less heavy cream while keeping a good consistency. Changes I made: I used real mushrooms, used extra milk as another review suggested, I used a Pinot Grigio white whine, also, I pounded some chicken breasts to 1/2" floured and fried to 50% done.. Lastly, I followed another review of using Kloski noodles and I liked that decision. It tasted amazing but my stomach didn't like how rich it was...

Recently my mother was given a tray of chicken tetrazzini from one of the ladies from her church. She didn't think she would like it so she gave it to me. It seems like it was homemade but it failed miserably in taste compared to this recipe. I've made this one several times and I plan on making it again to show my taste buds that chicken tetrazzini is actually delicious.

Fantastic recipe! I use 16 oz of fresh mushrooms instead of a lesser amount from a can, but other than that, I wouldn't change a thing. I'm about to make it again with chopped up turkey that I froze after Thanksgiving. I'm sure it'll be just as good as the chicken.

Best tetrazzini recipe ever! I made this for a crowd of 50 people. It was unbelievable the number of people who came up to me either wanting the recipe, or to tell me how good it was! Definitely a winner!

I make this for large family gatherings and it is always a hit. The kids love it as much as the adults. The only substitution I make is using fresh cut up mushrooms. When I serve the tetrazzini, I have cayenne pepper sitting next to it for people to add to spice the pasta up a little. This is a nice option for people who like to have a little heat with their food.

Used fresh mushrooms and followed recipe exactly. The 30 minutes was too long to bake in my oven. It was brown and bubbly in only 10. Watch it carefully! Flavor was great. Didn't find it bland at all. Perfect with garlic bread.
Other then using gluten free noodles and rice flour I made this according to the recipe. It was wonderful.

I made this last night and although my husband ate it, I could not finish mine. The sauce was actually cream gravy. Flour + whipping cream =cream gravy. And as others have noted it had absolutely zero taste.
So tasty!! Def one to keep and repeat. I baked chicken thighs in the oven and used the juices as my chicken stock. Yum yum yum.

Made exactly as the recipe called for and it is really bland.Next time I'll brown boneless skinless tenders in olive oil and butter on each side then saute diced onions, sliced green onions and minced garlic in the pan drippings. I'll double the roux in a separate pot then add more milk instead of heavy cream. The sauce should be thinner and more plentiful when put into the oven so the al dente spaghetti can absorb the liquid while keeping the casserole moist and creamy. 
Love the sherry and next time I'll add more to taste and use white pepper instead of black. I cooked the spaghetti in water with chicken bouillon for more flavor. It's just something I do, but not necessary. I think next time I will also add finely shredded parmesan, instead of grated, to the sauce and then top the casserole with Mozzarella or Italian Blend cheese. Another tip, Always taste the dish before putting it in the oven and adjust seasonings as needed. This sauce needed more seasoning! Everything is already cooked and warm so once it starts bubbling in the oven, it's done - it doesn't need an hour to cook.
Very creamy!

I've made this recipe once and I'm going to give it a go again tonight. This was the first recipe I tried with cooking wine or any kind of wine for that matter, and it turned out great! I am a newly married woman and I look forward to trying more recipes like this in the future. This one was great for breaking the ice in the kitchen for more homemade dishes.
This came out great!
I loved this recipe. It was easy to make and turned out very tasty. It reheats very well too. I used it for my lunch at work for a week and it was delicious every time. Highly recommended.
Absolutely outstanding! Used a dry Chardonnay since I didn't have sherry on hand and the flavor came through just fine. A keeper!
I will make this again! Loved the flavor.. I only added a whole onion and real bacon bits and sautéed in the butter.. Then followed the recipe!

My interest in trying this was twofold. The sherry and cream sounded reallly good. I had not made tetrazzini in ages so it was something different for a change. DH was impressed and wants to have it again. So be it!
Very popular in my house. I use fresh mushrooms and double the sauce.
Have made this a couple of times and I just love it. I did double the sauce and made it with penne tonight. The sherry adds a nice crisp flavor. Fresh mushrooms are a must. Who wouldn't love this!
I used canned mushrooms and half-n-half because that's what I had on hand, but I added lots of seasoning - garlic, onion, homemade chicken stock. This is the kind I grew up on, and it is awesome!
Ohh my....I am in LOVE! Followed the recipe exactly and WILL be making this again! A new favorite.

Very good but needed a few changes. Used linguine instead of spag noodles. Used regular milk instead of heavy cream. Sauteed fresh mushrooms with 1/2 diced onion and 2 cloves of minced garlich instead of just canned mushrooms. Used a bit of red pepper flakes just to add a bit of heat as a personal preference. It was great!!

I used Coffee Mate instead of cream to reduce the calories and keep the good taste. I added fresh spinach (instead of the mushrooms) which I quickly sauteed in olive oil for 60 seconds -- then folded in with the rest of the ingredients prior to baking.

Excellent!!! I added chopped green and white onions,chooped celery, garlic and a can of cream of mushrooms. Seasonned my chicken with 1/4 tsp of chipotle, lemon pepper seasonning, and paprika. I reduced the butter to half a cup. And woolaahh excellent flavors!!
I thought this was pretty good. It needed more sauce for the amount of pasta though. Next time I will double the sauce.
good base recipe, will make again

I prepared this recipe twice....once exactly as posted and once adding minced garlic, chopped onion and 1/4 cup white wine to replace the sherry. Both were VERY good tho the recipe as written may be a little bland for some tastes. For that reason I gave it a very solid four stars instead of five. This is a keeper. I will make it again.

WAY too much food for less than 12 people and super boring. This recipe has NO flavor. I even added onion and garlic. The amount of sauce it calls for with the amount of noodles is WAY too little. I doubles the recipe for sauce and it still wasn't quite enough.
